cat1.question: Explain detail description of step 13 (page 11).
cat1.answer: After completing the assembly of the desk top, this is the step of assembling the intermediate support frame for the desk drawer using Cam-Lock Screws.

cat1.question: Explain detail description of step 24 (page 17).
cat1.answer: Step 24 is the step of connecting the lower and upper parts of the desk using a wood dowel (serial number 101350). To facilitate connection, first lay down the bottom of the desk and connect the wood dowel. Then, two people hold the legs of the bottom of the desk and connect it to the top of the desk.

cat3.question: What happened to the furniture during step 4 (page 6) and step 5 (page 7)? What is changed?
cat3.answer: While step 4 involved assembling the side frame and each leg of the desk, step 5 begins with connecting the assembled side frame and front and back frames using wood dowels.

cat3.question: What happened to the furniture during step 11 (page 10) and step 12 (page 10)? What is changed?
cat3.answer: Step 11 is the step to assemble the lower part of the desk by turning the cam-lock screw (serial number 118331) clockwise. In Step 12, turn the desk upward and insert the same part, the cam-lock screw, into the groove by turning it clockwise.

cat6.question: What would be the short-term or long-term consequences if step 1 (page 4) is omitted during assembly?
cat6.answer: Step 1 represents inserting the screws (serial number 115348) into the leg of the bed. Since these screws are tightened with wheel locks at step 4 (page 6), if these steps are omitted, the leg part and bed frames are not securely tightened.

cat6.question: What would be the short-term or long-term consequences if step 37 (page 25) is omitted during assembly?
cat6.answer: Step 37 is the step to assemble the drawer to the desk. If this step of securing the drawer to the desk with a screw is omitted, the drawer will fall into the desk even if the drawer is opened as much as possible.
